history.content:
Interested in how Blockchain and Cryptocurrency works? Want to build your own decentralized applications and distributed systems? Blockchain at Berkeley is offering two DeCals this semester, the Blockchain Fundamentals DeCal and Blockchain for Developers DeCal. DeCal Application is due on February 1st, 11:59 P.M. at https://blockchain.berkeley.edu/apply/

Blockchain Fundamentals DeCal (CS 198-078)
1 Unit | Wednesdays 6 – 8 PM | 141 McCone Hall
A comprehensive survey of relevant topics in cryptocurrency and the wider blockchain space. From a technological standpoint, we start with the basics of cryptography and economics, establish a solid fundamental understanding of Bitcoin by building it from the bottom up, then explore the myriad of ideas and technologies relating to blockchain technology. On the non-technical side, we start with the history of digital currency, then look at the laws, organizations, trends, and communities behind it to build a complete picture of the ecosystem surrounding blockchain technology.
https://blockchain.berkeley.edu/courses/spring-2020-fundamentals-decal/

Blockchain for Developers DeCal (CS 198-077)
1 Units | Mondays 6:30PM – 8:30PM | 240 Mulford Hall
This course aims to teach students the fundamentals of blockchains, the Solidity programming language and Ethereum-based Decentralized Applications, as well as industry-relevant tools such as Metamask, Infuria, Truffle, and Ganache.
https://blockchain.berkeley.edu/spring-2020-developers-decal/
history.subject: Blockchain Fundamentals and Blockchain for Developers DeCal
